"Using this trading plan, Eric Schmidt can diversify his investment portfolio and can spread stock trades out over a period of one year to reduce market impact," Google said. Because this trading plan was established well in advance of a trade, it also helps avoid concerns about whether Eric Schmidt had material, non-public information when he made a decision to sell his stock. Yes, insider selling is all about diversifying portfolios, reducing market impact and avoiding concerns. No question. In any case, the shares Eric Schmidt plans to sell are all Class A shares-

national curriculum to be announced today. Education Secretary Michael Gove will launch his review of the national curriculum this morning with a clarion call for the restoration of "academic rigour" in state schools. The new national curriculum will therefore have a greater focus on subject content outlining the essential knowledge and understanding that pupils should be expected to have, says a background document of the new curriculum. In history, this will mean a move towards naming the individuals that pupils should learn about- such as Churchill, Nelson and Wellington. Traditionalists

a target. Labour's deputy leader Harriet Harman told Sky's Dermot Murnaghan that allegations of illegal activity must be investigated. "Hacking into people's phones is illegal," she said. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced. "Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist. The scandal has already cost Number 10 spin doctor Andy Coulson his job amid claims he presided over the illegal action at the tabloid. Officially, Mr. Paul Bremer reported to Mr. Donald Rumsfeld . But he viewed himself as the president's man, had a background in the State Department, and a relationship with Condoleezza Rice , says Mr. Donald Rumsfeld . So Mr. Paul Bremer chose what guidance he preferred, which Mr. Donald Rumsfeld describes as the equivalent of having "four or eight hands on the steering wheel."
